column4: To the women who was on shift in the petrol station at Sainsburys in Tamworth at 7.45am on Thursday 17th November I would just like to let you know that my little boy has just today being discharged from hospital after transferred via ambulance to Walsgrave Hospital with suspected pnemonia.  My little boy took ill on Thursday so I phoned 111 who advised me to take him to the hospital. After seeing my little boy so poorly and being physically sick I jumped in my car and headed for A&E. On the way I noticed my petrol light was on so I pulled in to get fuel. I put Â£25.00 of fuel in and went to pay to find I hadn t picked my purse up...(Yes I should have checked I had means of payment which I thought was in my little boy bag however in the haste of the moment I must have forgot to pick it up as it wasn t!)  After informing the young women at the counter who was very  helpful  in informing me it was a criminal offence and that she would be calling the police who would Pursue me immediately I told her I had to leave and couldn t wait the 30 mins for her to ring the police and carry out the checks etc. I offered for my husband (who was 78 miles away racing down the m6 to meet me at the hospital) to pay over the phone via our joint account to which she replied it wasn t acceptable and someone needed to bring me the money or my purse. I then attempted to return to my car to get my little boy at which point she very loudly told me I couldn t and had to remain in the shop. Obviously I went to get my little boy out of the car to find him being violently sick everywhere. After returning to the shop and cleaning him up the best I could I told her I would be calling the police to tell them I was having to drive off and told them they would find me at the the A&E department. To the very kind young gentleman who offered to lend me the money to enable me to leave to take my little boy to get the help he needed thank you so much. You really are a life saver! I didn t know this chap from Adam and despite offering him my name  address and tel num he just took my num and said he would call me later - which he did and my husband left the money with the neighbour ready for him to collect.  Once the other women working in the Petrol station saw how poorly my little boy was they were very apologetic asking if they could do anything and apologising for adding stress to what was a very stressful situation for me. I know the staff have protocols to follow and I know I could have been pulling a fast one however they could clearly see I was distressed  upset and hopefully genuine. This is my local store  I hold a nectar card which although I didn t have on me it was in my purse I m sure she could have found me on the system somehow.  After speaking to people about my experience they have all said that if they have done it before or knew of someone who has done it they have had to fill a form in and take payment within 24 hours or face being reported to the police. Thankfully after being on a enebaliser for 2 days and then oxygen for a further 24 hours  2 chest X-rays  inhalers and antibiotics my little boy had a severe chest infection and bronchitis. Thankfully after his 2nd chest X-ray this morning it was confirmed he didn t have pneumonia.  We are now finally home but I would just like to show my sheer disgust to the young women in the petrol station that morning. I know I was 100% at fault for having no means of payment on me but there was certainly a better way of dealing with the matter in question! I will be speaking with the store manager but anyone in the same circumstances if you forget your purse expect to be embarrassed in front of a shop full of people and  spoken to by the staff of Sainsburys like a child!
column9: Hi Danni, the store has come back to us to ensure us that they are still investigating this issue. They would like you to send us your contact details so that they are able to get in contact with you personally. Can you please PM them to me? Thanks, Gabby.

column9: I work for a different Sainsburys petrol station and I can tell you, unless there is a difference across the country (which I am 95% sure there isn't), that is not the right protocol! I can't believe what I've read above with the way you were dealt with, especially considering the circumstances you were in ðŸ˜¢ glad your little boy is better x

column9: Hi Ryan. Firstly thank you for your reply it is much appreciated. Unfortunately I wasn't given a receipt as I handed the lady the money that was lent to me in the back store room and then shot off to the hospital. From my phone records I rang my husband at 7.30am to ask him to pay, rang the police at 7.33am and was back on the road and on the phone to my husband at 7.45am so the incident would have taken place just before 7.30am. There was only 2 staff working from what I recall seeing a young women in her 20's or early 30's with blonde hair and a older women with short dark hair - who was very helpful in helping me with my little boy in the store cupboard and was very apologetic.

column9: Hi Danni, I'm so sorry for the experience you've had. It's certainly not what we expect from our colleagues and we'll make sure that this was investigated. It'll give me most of the details I need. Ryan.

Once the other women working in the Petrol station saw how poorly my little boy was they were very apologetic asking if they could do anything and apologising for adding stress to what was a very stressful situation for me. I know the staff have protocols to follow and I know I could have been pulling a fast one however they could clearly see I was distressed  upset and hopefully genuine. This is my local store  I hold a nectar card which although I didn t have on me it was in my purse I m sure she could have found me on the system somehow.  After speaking to people about my experience they have all said that if they have done it before or knew of someone who has done it they have had to fill a form in and take payment within 24 hours or face being reported to the police. Thankfully after being on a enebaliser for 2 days and then oxygen for a further 24 hours  2 chest X-rays  inhalers and antibiotics my little boy had a severe chest infection and bronchitis. Thankfully after his 2nd chest X-ray this morning it was confirmed he didn t have pneumonia.  We are now finally home but I would just like to show my sheer disgust to the young women in the petrol station that morning. I know I was 100% at fault for having no means of payment on me but there was certainly a better way of dealing with the matter in question! I will be speaking with the store manager but anyone in the same circumstances if you forget your purse expect to be embarrassed in front of a shop full of people and  spoken to by the staff of Sainsburys like a child!
column9: Take it further take it sainsburys head office, she shouldn't be working there the heartless B***! Specially when there's a child involved obviously well HOPEFULLY she isn't a mother HERSELF!!!  Nice to hear there's still some good hearted people out there Hope your sons recovering well all the best xXx .

column4: Hi Sainsburys   I went into your Rustington store with my 2 young children today and decided to eat in the cafÃ©. I was dubious as My daughter cut her hand on one of your knives which had been given to us as child friendly but in fact was not suitable for children  this was about 6 months ago and following a complaint  which was resolved  I was assured there is children s cutlery available in your family friendly cafÃ© s. I was surprised today  when again we asked for children s cutlery  to be presented with the same adult cutlery as before. This is sharper than your usual cutlery as it s for people who are disabled. I challenged staff and was disappointed to be told this is what he d been told to give to children and was the only cutlery available for them. When will children s safety be put first!?!   On a positive note the customer service desk were extremely helpful and accommodating with an exchange I needed to do today. I just wish you d be more accommodating for your younger customers.
column9: Sorry Ruth, what time did you visit the store? I'll get this logged with the store management. Steven

column4: Hi Sainsbury s - I had a query which I sent to customer services (twice) but never received a reply so I thought I would post on here instead! I recently went to a local store in Bournemouth where a member of staff was throwing away some in store baked baguettes. I understand that you recycle your food waste now - this is great PR for your company but if the food is still edible and could be sold off cheaply for its intended purpose (to be eaten) like Co-Op for example. I asked the member of staff about this and was informed that you get about 50% of the price back for sending it to be recycled. This is obviously a better financial bet for Sainsbury s but it is certainly not the most environmentally friendly option  like we are being led to believe! Correct me if I am wrong but this is known as  greenwash . Please respond.
column9: The bread is sold to a company called Sugarich who then turn it into animal feed.

column9: Hi - the store is in Southbourne. That's great that no food goes to landfill but I have never noticed any bakery items being reduced in order to sell them off to customers. If more money is made by throwing away (albeit recycled) then the incentive to reduce the price must be minimal. I'm not yet convinced.

column4: Hi Sainsbury s - I had a query which I sent to customer services (twice) but never received a reply so I thought I would post on here instead! This is obviously a better financial bet for Sainsbury s but it is certainly not the most environmentally friendly option  like we are being led to believe! Correct me if I am wrong but this is known as  greenwash . Please respond.
column9: Morning Joe! What store did you notice this in? None of our food waste go to landfills, instead it is donated, turned into animal feed or used in anaerobic digestion. Goods baked in-store, due to their short shelf life, are unsuitable for donation to local charities so will be sent off to be utilised in the other ways mentioned. Our website has more information on this - http://bit.ly/1A2wsE0 Dee

column4: Hi Sainsbury s - I had a query which I sent to customer services (twice) but never received a reply so I thought I would post on here instead! Correct me if I am wrong but this is known as  greenwash . Please respond.
column9: Hi Gillian, we don't send any food waste to landfill. We have a commitment to lowering food waste and if you click the link we provided to Joe above, you'll be able to read more on how we utilise food waste including how we generate electricity with it to power one of our stores. Ryan.

column9: Sainsbury's  I am well aware that no food waste goes to landfill,and that's great but I think we both know that you're dodging the issue I'm raising. Please do a quick search on the ""waste hierarchy"" and it will show you that just because you are recycling something doesn't mean it's the greenest option. As I said, I see know reduced items in my local store. Maybe you are right Gillian Winn !

column4: Hi Sainsbury s - I had a query which I sent to customer services (twice) but never received a reply so I thought I would post on here instead! I asked the member of staff about this and was informed that you get about 50% of the price back for sending it to be recycled. This is obviously a better financial bet for Sainsbury s but it is certainly not the most environmentally friendly option  like we are being led to believe! Correct me if I am wrong but this is known as  greenwash . Please respond.
column9: Hi Joe, we'll sometimes reduce products to help them sell but there are certain items we can't do this with. Bakery items, for example, due to their short shelf life can't be collected by local charity partners so we'll either turn them into animal feed to support British farmers or turned into green energy. As I mentioned, the link above will give you all the details about what happens to food we don't sell. It also includes an image which explains the entire process. Ryan.

column4: Today I went shopping with my mum  my 2 sisters  niece and my own 2 children (20 month old daughter and 13 week old son). We d finished our shopping in your Bretton  Peterborough store and my mum and myself were getting my son s coat on. My daughter was stood next to us waiting for her coat to be put on. We hear a huge thud and turn to find my daughter flat out on the floor deathly white. We grabbed her off the floor and she started screaming much to our relief! The security guard near by saw what happened and came over to check she was ok and called for first aid. He waited with us until someone came. A lady called Sue appeared and checked her head  I m not 100% sure if she was first aid but still took us to the pharmacy for my daughter to be checked over. He gave us advice about signs of concussion and we bought some paracetamol to give her straight away. Another lady appeared with a bag of ice from the fish counter for my daughter s head. My daughter was obviously still very upset  so Sue kindly went to find her some chocolate buttons which she gave her for free. And then asked us to go sit in the cafe and got us all a coffee for free too and asked us to stay for a while to make sure my daughter was ok. Sue took my details for the accident book and has said she s going to ring me tomorrow afternoon to check my daughter is still ok. Today was the most scared I ve been since having my daughter - I ve never seen her so pale or look so scared and in pain. Sue was calm  helpful and generous. Fantastic customer service along with the other employees involved. Thank you so much to Sue x
column9: She's tucked up in bed after some more paracetamol. Must be a bit traumatised as she's told her daddy all about it several times since he's been home from work. But she's ok thank you â˜ºï¸ x

column4: I just want to leave some praise for one of the checkout operators in your Banbury store today. The lady was called Namb and she showed an amazing level of customer service. A slightly older lady was in front of me and she was struggling with her shopping. The checkout lady took her time to help the customer load her shopping and then organise and pack it while explaining what she was putting in each bag so the customer knew where everything was when she got home. Your employee apologised to me several times for the wait  but it was just lovely to see someone displaying such care and patience for a customer. Sainsbury s  if you hand out employee of the month awards  this member of staff deserves one  she is a credit to your company. Amazing customer service  above and beyond what anyone would reasonable expect.
column9: Hi Rebekah! It's always a pleasure to hear about excellent customer service in our stores! Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I've made the Banbury store aware of Namb's job well done. Have a great day! Dee

column4: I just wanted to say a huge thank you to Steven in your Stirling store. Yesterday I went in and asked for Â£10 to be put on 3 Sainsbury s gift cards. While Steven was putting them through I explained that they were for a friend Alison Long who had lost her 2 year old son  Oliver  to neuroblastoma cancer and who every year since then (this is now the 8th year!) has put together a collection of pyjamas and slippers to take to Little Haven s Hospice and Great Ormond Street Hospital where he had been looked after. But because we live so far away  I send down some gift cards. He immediately reached behind him and added another Â£20 card. Thank you so much - I know such generosity and thoughtfulness will be much appreciated by Alison and her family.
column9: Go Sainsburys this is amazing xc

column4: Just visited you Fareham store to find you have a sale  brilliant i thought  however the bits I wanted weren t in the right size. I drove to your hedge end store where I found the exact same items of clothing but at the original price. I bought this up with your staff on customer service to be told they re not in the sale here. How can it be one price in one store and another in another store! There even in the sale online! Disappointed is an understatement as i really like your clothing but guess I wont bother to drive around again!
column9: What sale was this item a part of? Do you recall how much the item was discontinued for? Dee

column4: 8:29pm  Hello  I hope you can help. I have just checked my nectar points balance after using 4 000 points to double up on clothing last week and it is showing as -8 000 points! I was only able to use 1 lot of 4000 points on clothes so I don t know how they managed to take off 8 000. As you can understand that is a huge amount of points to be missing!
column9: They gave you a bonus 4,000 and then deducted the original 4,000 and the bonus 4,000  Give it a day or two to fully update on your account

column4: 8:29pm  Hello  I hope you can help. I have just checked my nectar points balance after using 4 000 points to double up on clothing last week and it is showing as -8 000 points! I was only able to use 1 lot of 4000 points on clothes so I don t know how they managed to take off 8 000. As you can understand that is a huge amount of points to be missing!
column9: Hi Sarah! I know this looks scary, but the actual correct amount of points have been taken off. To ensure our Double up promotion works correctly, Nectar add an extra 4000 points to your card, then remove 8000. This is to ensure you are only really spending 4000 of our own points. Dee

column4: Not happy sainsburys! Have bought 3 phone charges over the last 2 months now they have all stopped working.  Took them into plymouth sainsburys and spoke to a very Un helpful member of staff who was so  rude. I asked for the customer services number she told me too look it up on the Internet.also asked for the company of the chargers number she said she didn t know it.   She told me she couldn t help with the chargers even though they were all from the same company plus bought all from sainsburys. So obviously a manufacturer problem! She said she will put them in the bin for me and she did without me even saying so!! I ended up buying another 2 chargers!! Not happy!!!

column4: As a customer of Sainsbury s I would respectfully ask that you refrain from selling John West Tuna. This company is apparently causing untold damage to many other species in our oceans by the use of inappropriate fishing gear.  In order to preserve dwindling stocks of tuna  it would be a better idea if everyone would refrain from buying tuna at all  at least until stocks can be recovered.
column9: Up to a point I agree.  I salute those who try to raise alarms in the early stages of potentially disastrous practices, but unfortunately, it would seem that people in general only start to become aware when it is almost too late.  That said it doesn't mean that we should just thrown in the towel and do nothing at all.  It is a pity we have allowed 'big business' to operate with impunity throughout the world - all in the search for profit above what is ethical and sensible.  We are allowing moneygrabbers to mortgage the futures of our children and grandchildren.  It may be too late for such of me, but I am particularly alarmed for the next and following generations.

column4: As a customer of Sainsbury s I would respectfully ask that you refrain from selling John West Tuna. This company is apparently causing untold damage to many other species in our oceans by the use of inappropriate fishing gear.  In order to preserve dwindling stocks of tuna  it would be a better idea if everyone would refrain from buying tuna at all  at least until stocks can be recovered.
column9: We all have the opportunity right now to do our bit in letting the oceans start to recover, by not eating any fish at all. We dont need it in our diet in the western world when we have other options,  there are many people that do not eat fish for ethical reasons so yes some people are actualy doing thier bit before it's too late ... and you could too Kev.

column4: As a customer of Sainsbury s I would respectfully ask that you refrain from selling John West Tuna. This company is apparently causing untold damage to many other species in our oceans by the use of inappropriate fishing gear.  In order to preserve dwindling stocks of tuna  it would be a better idea if everyone would refrain from buying tuna at all  at least until stocks can be recovered.
column9: Here's a concept...considering the shelf life of canned tuna can be 3 years or even longer, the chances are you're going to have to do without eating canned tuna for a good few years to come. Not buying it only serves to make the deaths of other sea creatures that get caught up in the tuna nets worth even less as well as wasting perfectly good food into the bargain. I find it amazing how we all get so  conservation aware when the deeds have already been done. Just for one time I would like to see conservation groups start their campaigns BEFORE its too late to make a difference instead of getting all precious when its too late

column4: Hello I hope you are well. My girlfriend and I are strictly vegan  due to a combination of dietary requirements and moral reasons. We often shop in our local sainsburys store in bedford and are very happy with the range on offer. Our particular favourite is your  free from  pesto which we eat a couple of times a week. Last week we did our regular shop and picked up our usual pesto  from the  free from   aisle along with pasta and a selection of vegetables.  This evening we decided to roast the veg and stir the pesto in. Not thinking we had to check the jar  we proceeded as usual  chopping up a variety of veg and adding the sauce. To our horror (luckily before we had eaten it) we discovered that the pesto which we had purchased was the original variety  containing cheese. Not only are we having to start cooking again but we have also wasted roughly ten pounds on ingredients that will now be thrown away.  We thoroughly enjoyed shopping regularly in your stores but this evening s events have been a shock. If  for example  I had an allergy to an ingredient in the pesto which we purchased  the end result could have much worse. We look forward to your reply  yours faithfully   James Dudley.
column9: I'm blind and so is my girlfriend so we assumed the product would be in the designated aisle.

We thoroughly enjoyed shopping regularly in your stores but this evening s events have been a shock. If  for example  I had an allergy to an ingredient in the pesto which we purchased  the end result could have much worse. We look forward to your reply  yours faithfully   James Dudley.

column4: Can you tell me why you are still refusing to do anything anbout the unsustainable fishing you still support and sell reported by Greenpeace. What a disgrace!
column9: Hi Jade! We are the UKâ€™s leading retailer of sustainable fish. We wholeheartedly share Greenpeace's goal of improving fishing practices across the world, which makes it all the more disappointing to be the sole focus of this campaign. John West is working with WWF to drive up its sustainability status by 2018 and we are closely monitoring the progress. We have been absolutely clear that If targets are not met, we will reconsider our relationship with JW. But we know it's more effective to work with businesses to tackle issues rather than simply turning our backs. Holly

column4: Would publicly like to thank all the staff of the Whitchurch  Shropshire store  thank you really does not seem enough but its all i have ;-) today a female stole my voucher valued at Â£53.52  it was monies i had saved for my Grand Children s tins of sweets for Christmas ..i had a senior moment  and left the voucher on the customer service desk  within minuets she had cashed it and left the store  staff could not have done more for me  i was so hurt and felt so stupid but thanks to the ladies who brought comforting coffee and kind words  i don t feel as stupid as i did ...to the scumbag who took it ..hope you smiled ..your on camera :-) thank you again ladies and manager ..wishing you all a very very Happy Christmas xxxxxxx
column9: i feel really awful that i did'nt get names ,i was so upset i was'nt thinking straight but there where so many that came over ,coffee hugs and tissues ..bless them all ..am still feeling very emotional now ,they where just so lovely ,caring and thoughtful  ...and yes ,thank you all was sorted and i am so grateful ...many many thanks again xxxx

column4: Slightly delayed but......I gave birth to my second child in August as my eldest started to school in September  one day about a month ago (maybe slightly longer!) I was due to pick up my son from school but had to dash to Sainsbury s Didcot on the way  I was in such a hurry I carried my baby in  I collected up my groceries and headed for a self service till. A member of staff who I m quite sure is called Jay took my shopping from me  scanned and bagged them for me. I find it quite shocking these days how few people will help someone in those situations and I for one can tell you endless stories of people walking by when I have needed help so I can t express how grateful if was when Jay helped me that day and I won t forget how kind that was. I would also like to say that Jay has served me many times and he is always so happy to be interacting with people and always as helpful as possible. Jay is truly a credit not only to your Didcot store but to Sainsbury s as a whole.
column9: That's lovely feedback Kirsty! I've forwarded this to management in store so Jay can be recognised. Thanks for taking the time to share it with us. Faiza.

column4: Hi there  can you confirm if I can return clothing bought in a normal store to a Saintsbury s Local please? I have the receipt and it is within 30 days. Thanks
column9: You cannot

column4: Hi there  can you confirm if I can return clothing bought in a normal store to a Saintsbury s Local please? I have the receipt and it is within 30 days. Thanks
column9: Depends why you want to return it. If it's faulty you can, as they're legally obliged to deal with it. If you just don't want it anymore or it's the wrong size then they're not obliged to refund it and so can dictate where you return it too, which would likely be the store you bought it from or one with clothing for sale.

I questioned this as to why something with a label on.. off the rail could not be sold to me.. and as she Walked off she muttered something about  recall    headoffice  and just walked off with it! column9: Hi Mary, I totally understand your concern. Please be assured we pride ourselves on having good supplier relationships and work with them to ensure our high standards are met. Ethical trading is a key part of this relationship. We require all our suppliers to meet the Sainsburyâ€™s Code of Conduct for Ethical Trade which is based on the Ethical Trading Initiative Base Code for ethical sourcing. Our code covers 12 key principles, and this includes no child labour.  Our suppliers are required to show compliance against this code and to provide evidence of continuous improvement in worker welfare. Suppliers must have in place their own code of conduct, policies and systems to manage ethical trade, and be able to report their progress to us. We also risk assess all our suppliers and conduct regular, independent, third party ethical audits where required. I hope this puts your mind at ease when purchasing these products from us. Ryan.

Once upon a time they were so awesome I could eat a whole pack to myself in a day ðŸ˜³ But for a while now I ve been giving the bakery the benefit of the doubt  build up my excitement that this time they will be perfect again  and yet again been disappointed.  Has the recipe changed?   They seem overly sweet and the sugar isn t helping the baking process as they are also more crunchy than soft cookie. Which also isn t helped if they are overbaked.  Plus there are less white chocolate bits in and as for the raspberry - even David Attenborough would have a hard time finding it ðŸ˜¢ They were the only thing making my Uni assignments bearable but now in my last year I can t have anything distracting my work so sadly might have to search elsewhere for something to replace them.   Or can you change the recipe back?ðŸ™ðŸ»

column4: I honestly can not fault your staff at Sainsbury s Ellesmere Port  my purse was stolen off a conveyor belt in your store this morning. Your staff went above and beyond trying to help me retrace my steps too see if I had left it anywhere else  unfortunately cctv confirmed that it had actually been stolen. I was really shocked and upset but your staff rallied round me offering me hot drinks  offering to use their phones to phone the police and even said I could take some of my shopping if I was desperate for it (I hadn t actually paid for my shopping at this point)! I left your store to go home and calm down and phone the police and cancel everything ðŸ˜©ðŸ˜© went back to the store a couple of hours later and one of your lovely team members had packed all of my shopping and placed it in the back ready for me! To top of my morning I had previously doubled up my nectar points (Â£20-Â£40) but thankfully they have been refunded back to my card!  Your staff truly are a credit!  Thank you so so much staff at Ellesmere Port!!
column9: A horrendous day!! Hoping we will got some really good cctv images so fingers crossed!! Xxx

column9: This is the position now and why I'm boycotting Sainsbury's for now. 'Tesco and Waitrose have committed to remove John West tuna from their shelves if they donâ€™t clean up their act. But Sainsburyâ€™s are refusing to do the same.  Earlier this year, the Greenpeace ship Esperanza travelled to the Indian Ocean to investigate unsustainable fishing practices. They found destructive fishing devices (that kill sharks and turtles) belonging to Thai Union, the company who owns John West.  Meanwhile in the UK, hundreds of you took action in Sainsburyâ€™s stores up and down the country. Youâ€™ve visited your local branches, called Sainsburyâ€™s customer services and posted on their social media channels. Over 100,000 emails have been sent to Sainsburyâ€™s CEO â€“ the issue was even raised at their AGM!  Sainsburyâ€™s have made it quite clear that they donâ€™t want to listen to concerns about sustainability â€“ so weâ€™ve brought them a message they canâ€™t ignore.'  Greenpeace

column9: Reply from nectar  Hi Hazel, really sorry about this. The process for redeeming points with the Double Up promotion has changed this year. To process the redemption via Sainsbury's till systems they will initially have to remove the full value of points and then refund half the points back instantly. However, due to a technical issue, it is now taking up to 72 hours to refund the points. Sorry for any inconvenience caused. Craig

column4: I popped into my local store ( Stroud  Gloucestershire) on Friday evening  when I went to pay my card was refused 3 times. Myself and my partner with highly embarrassed especially considering my partners mental health issues as well as it being payday and we knew there was no reason for the card to decline. After mentioning to the lady on self service she informed us it was a problem with the card machines. So we went to the cash point got cash and paid for the shopping.  About an hour after getting home I logged on to our banking to notice just over Â£120 missing from my account so ring the nice lady at Barclays to be informed that while your machines are saying declined they are still taking your money!! The lady did say that they had been informed that Sainsbury s would return the money within 24 hours.   So here I am writing this with no money returned!! Â£120 might not seem a lot to some but it is to is and to be honest I m not only Â£120 down but disgusted!! So here I am waiting on my money be returned god knows when   a lot with I m sure a lot more customers!  But don t worry mr Sainsbury s I feel so secure when spending my money with you I ll be back to shop again .......NOT!
column9: When they were aware of the issue but didn't inform the customer ... yes it is

column4: This is of some concern to me....  Congratulations to Sainsbury s for taking the plunge and introducing vinyl albums in your stores  with my nectar double up I had already earmarked several albums to restart and enhance my collection. I went in store and looked at what I wanted to buy  and I was a little concerned as to the way they were merchandised. Earlier this year I was in your Exeter store and saw you were selling vinyl there  but these were displayed in bins where you could flip happily through   the ones displayed in your Fareham Broadcut store were placed overlapping on shelves no wider than two inches wide...  when I saw it I thought that this is a disaster waiting to happen  and sure enough it did within two minutes someone came along picked a record from one end and twenty plus albums fell to the floor  I helped to put them back on the shelf and looked through carefully taking albums out and looking at the track listing. I did notice some damage on the David Bowie albums which were my target to buy on the double up. A week later I am in and looking again at the albums  all the damaged albums are still there on the shelf  I sorted them out and took them over to the service desk and explained the damage to the assistant and as far as I could see they put them out of the way. I was in again on Thursday to choose my albums for the double up  all the albums I was going to choose were badly damaged  they were hunky dory lp  and Aladdin sane by bowie  and welcome to the pleasure dome by frankie goes to Hollywood..... I chose other lps that were undamaged. By different artistes. Not Happy.... The point I am making is that these albums are a premium price and are being treated like bags of spuds  what was worse was the albums I had given to the assistant as damaged were back out on display STILL DAMAGED!!! Come on get your act sorted out  get your merchandising sorted out and make sure that if damaged goods are re-merchandised they are reduced in price to reflect the damage and state the damage..... I shop in broadcut on a regular basis and I will be raising this issue with the store management as an unacceptable practice.
column9: Hi Kev! Thanks for bringing this to our attention. We'll contact the store and make them aware. Once they've replied with the action they're going to take, we'll reply. Thanks, Daniel.

column4: This is of some concern to me....  Congratulations to Sainsbury s for taking the plunge and introducing vinyl albums in your stores  with my nectar double up I had already earmarked several albums to restart and enhance my collection. I went in store and looked at what I wanted to buy  and I was a little concerned as to the way they were merchandised. Earlier this year I was in your Exeter store and saw you were selling vinyl there  but these were displayed in bins where you could flip happily through   the ones displayed in your Fareham Broadcut store were placed overlapping on shelves no wider than two inches wide...  when I saw it I thought that this is a disaster waiting to happen  and sure enough it did within two minutes someone came along picked a record from one end and twenty plus albums fell to the floor  I helped to put them back on the shelf and looked through carefully taking albums out and looking at the track listing. I did notice some damage on the David Bowie albums which were my target to buy on the double up. A week later I am in and looking again at the albums  all the damaged albums are still there on the shelf  I sorted them out and took them over to the service desk and explained the damage to the assistant and as far as I could see they put them out of the way. I was in again on Thursday to choose my albums for the double up  all the albums I was going to choose were badly damaged  they were hunky dory lp  and Aladdin sane by bowie  and welcome to the pleasure dome by frankie goes to Hollywood..... I chose other lps that were undamaged. By different artistes. Not Happy.... The point I am making is that these albums are a premium price and are being treated like bags of spuds  what was worse was the albums I had given to the assistant as damaged were back out on display STILL DAMAGED!!! Come on get your act sorted out  get your merchandising sorted out and make sure that if damaged goods are re-merchandised they are reduced in price to reflect the damage and state the damage..... I shop in broadcut on a regular basis and I will be raising this issue with the store management as an unacceptable practice.
column9: Hi Kev, We have had a response from the store and the buying team. They have taken action to reduce the risk of titles falling from the bay and therefore getting damaged. This involves implementing an additional plastic insert to the left hand side of the fixture, which holds in the titles should they be pulled forward as described below. Paul

column4: I have been loyal to Sainsburyâ€™s for over two decades  but enough is enough.  I have just been onto the Sainsbury s customer care line to complain that their St Phillips Bristol is now closed for refurbishment.  I explained it would have been nice if the store had actually told me it would be closing when I was there during the week previously.   They apologised and said that I needed to look on the Sainsbury website to check if a store is open.  After #lol â€œI said she must be joking  you are expecting me to check your every time I want to go shopping?â€. Realising that was not such a clever answer the apologised again and said that we make a note and let their internal teams know. I then asked what does that mean and they just repeated the statement.  I was on the call for over 15 minutes and they never even asked for my name.  I estimate that thousands of customers have turned up to the store only to find it closed.  How can a supermarket chain treat their loyal customers this way.
column9: Hi Martin, apologies for all the confusion. All of the information regarding stores is available on the website so that it can reach more customers who use the website frequently. The colleague followed procedure and logged your concerns. Please be assured of this. Thanks. Daryl.

column4: Hello Sainsburys   During your last 25% Tu event  I used your Click and Collect service for the first time.  I was ordering Christmas presents for family and had pre-arranged which items I would buy for their children so had to be organised. I can honestly say  it was the worst and most time consuming order I have ever made. I thought it would be easier and quicker to buy the items online  with the ease of walking instore and picking it all up at once.  Unfortunately  due to an error on your systems  my payment wasn t processed. I wasn t contacted to say there was an issue with my order and so I went in store to collect my items before I was informed of your error. By this point your event had finished and so I was directed to your website  for the customer service team. When I spoke to them I was told that they could offer an evoucher for the saving I would have received  however all the items online were out of stock. So I would have to look for the items myself in store. And so the evoucher would prove pointless. I requested that I have the items located so I could pick them up in store  which I was told would happen. So I emailed over my most convenient stores and then received an email with the evoucher not long after. After a week of hearing nothing else about the instore stock  I emailed again to ask why I hadn t heard anything and was told that I had received the evoucher  but that wasn t the point!  This is the worst customer service I have ever received. I m fed up now. I have been running round in circles for 2 weeks and I just want this fixed as soon as possible. Are you able to offer any help  because I am at my wits end?  Kind regards  Justine  Order 3051500
column9: I have done so

column9: Hi Emily, our technologists have come back to us with:   Within the 800g loaf the soya flour contains properties that support the quality of the product through the dough making stages. Steven

Imagine my disappointment  stress and anger when 9/10 times they ve sold out of cheese sauce! The other flavour sauces are NEVER SOLD OUT.   Only this very evening I filled my bag for life with Cravendale and Cava but found the cheese sauce stock completely exhausted. I m flipping exhausted I can tell you!!   It s like a falcon punch to my shriveled ovaries  having been trapped in servitude all day  only to be laughed at by am empty cheese sauce shelf.   I just wanted one measly pot of cheese sauce ðŸ˜¥ðŸ˜¥ðŸ˜¥  Please have a word in the ear of the procurement department  responsible for the provision of stock  to ensure that evening visitors are not cheated out of a cheese sauce supper by daytime muggle shoppers.  Thanking you in advance  for ensuring a healthy stock of cheese sauce ensues forthwith.  Cheese sauce officionado x
column9: Hi there! If you could DM us with your Nectar card number I'll pop some points on so you can have that  pot of cheese on us! Robyn

column4: Just wanted to share with you my experience from Wednesday. I was in the queue  and the customer two in front of myself was a young male with tattoos on his neck and arms. A very smart  well dressed young guy not that this should make any difference. Anyway once he had left the till  the customer in front said  oh did you see those horrible tattoos . The cashier (Jill I think she was called) replied oh I know  weren t they dreadful. The two of them went on to have a conversation about this customer (who had just spent money in your store) in a horrible and judgemental way  stating the tattoos look ugly and make him look dirty (with absolutely no effort to be quiet). The conversation then went on to how the cashier thought all tattoos are horrible  particularly ok girls. Now I don t care what anyone thinks of my personal choices  but they should care about those either but I have tattoos myself. The first conversation would have definitely caused offence to the customer and the second comments could have quite easily offended myself. They didn t  but it s angered me and disgusted me. I work in retail myself as an area manager for Aldi  and if I thought for once moment that a staff member would speak to a customer to blatantly about another staff I d be disgusted.  I reported this to customer services at the time in store  who did agree it wasn t acceptable however I have come home and got angrier and angrier about this. I saw the customer outside and almost told him but I didn t actually want him to know what small minded people had said about him.
column9: That's disgusting behaviour! Well done for reporting it

Yes they are but not when they represent the store and are causing offence. Well done you for speaking out xx

column4: Hi...I m just wondering why the cucumbers sold in your stores are wrapped in a plastic cover  to me it is not required and causing unnecessary plastic waste which goes to landfill as local authorities tend not to accept it for recycling. And before you inform me that it is  a requirement this  wrapping  does not apply to loose items such as green peppers and loose fruit such as apples. Can you review the procedures and lower your companies footprint/ indirect waste please.

column4: Disgusted by the way i have been treated by Sainsbury s warren heath. I am a registered cake maker and bought Â£34 worth of ingredients from the store it took me a whole day to make several cakes which I had to throw every single one away as they were inedible. I then bought from my regular supplier and everything was fine. Emailed Sainsbury s to be told they were very sorry and would add Â£10 onto my nectar card which I told them was an insult as I was still Â£24 out of pocket not to mention a whole day wasted baking what a joke won t be shopping there again in a hurry.
column9: Â£10 was an insult due to all the wastage and time it took me to bake the cakes,it was obviously the ingredients from Sainsburys as my cakes were fine before and after I shopped at my usual suppliers

The help from the person on the till was  we ve just stopped doing that  if you re not happy you can always not buy them...  (wonderful) any thoughts on this at all Sainsbury s?
column9: Hi Andrew. I'm sorry it wasn't made clear that the promotion had ended in store. As an apology for the poor customer service, I'd like to add some points to your Nectar card. If you'd like this arranged, please PM me your Nectar card number. Thanks, Sonny

column4: Hi. I hate what plastic is doing to this planet  especially to ocean life. Every tiny reduction in plastic packaging is useful. So you might think I m daft but ... take a look at the Sainsbury s extra care soft toothbrush. You could HALVE the plastic in that wrapper: it doesn t need a plastic bubble both sides  just 1 transparent side backed with flat card. And how many more products could reduce plastic packaging  especially in food? Please. This is important. Remember how consumers and producers reduced and largely got rid of damaging CFC propellants. It s our world and it s at tipping point *now*.
column9: Hi Chloe, Please see this link http://bit.ly/1CTYoI5 This shows what we do to help the environment. Paul

column4: Hi  I ve been subscribed to the Sainsbury s Magazine since February but for some reason I haven t received November s issue. It normally comes a few days before the 1st or the next few days after.There doesn t seem to be a good way of contacting anyone about this either. Can anyone help?
column9: Hi Jordana! If you give them a call on 0333 777 3349 (option 3), they'll be able to assist. Thanks, Daniel.

column4: Hiya  I d like to do a shout out to some flawless customer service.  I was at the Woodhall Farm Sainsbury s in Hemel Hempstead with my mum about an hour ago when I started to feel REALLY faint. This is common for me  I m generally pretty faint or lightheaded if I haven t eaten (which I hadn t). I can usually breathe through it until I can get round to eating something  but this time around I couldn t. I ended up laying myself down outside the store  as sitting upright was too difficult.  Amazingly the first person to approach me was a paramedic! I never caught his name but I d love to thank him for keeping me calm before the Sainsbury s staff came out.  I can t express enough gratitude to the staff members that talked me through my fainting episode  helped me off the cold ground  brought me inside  fed me tea and toast in a quiet area of the store and chatted with me until I felt loads better.  I especially want to thank Natalie who got me through the entire thing while so wonderfully friendly. As I felt better and got up to leave with my mum  Natalie gave me a huge box of shortbread biscuits and told me to eat! I can t get over how generous Natalie and the rest of the staff were (in my dizzy state I forgot their names!) and I wanted to be able to thank them properly. Sainsbury s have incredible customer service  especially at Woodhall Farm where it is truly like a family there within their staff  and that should never be overlooked.  I ll definitely be back in there to thank them all personally. The shortbread biscuits have worked a treat!  Thank you so much  it may not feel like it to you  but what you did for me was nothing short of heroic.  Biiiiig love.
column9: Hello Jennifer! Aww I'm glad your well. I have contacted the store, they will pass this onto Natalie. Enjoy your biscuits... I love shortbread! Thanks, Kelly.

column4: #FeedmetheTruth I want to know which foods Sainsbury s sell that have GMOs including animals fed GMO feed?
column9: Hi Liz! We do not permit the sale of own brand food, drink, pet food, dietary supplements or floral products that contain GM material. We are also aware that some customers have concerns regarding products from animals that may have been fed a diet containing GM material.  As part of offering a choice to our customers, we offer a range of own brand organic products which guarantees the animals are fed a non-GM diet. Thanks, Daniel.

column4: #FeedmetheTruth I want to know which foods Sainsbury s sell that have GMOs including animals fed GMO feed?
column9: We are only able to give information on Sainsburys own branded products. To find out more about GMOs in other brands you would be best speaking to the manufacturers direct. Maria

column4: #FeedmetheTruth I want to know which foods Sainsbury s sell that have GMOs including animals fed GMO feed?
column9: But you do permit the sale of other products that have GMOs I don't want GMOs in anything I eat so until I can be sure I can trust Sainsburys isn't selling ANY GMO's including processed food ingredients particularly sourced outside the UK such as Soya which the UK does not enforce labeling of GMOs I'm afraid I can't shop there. Considering the proof of the dangers of GMOs to all life.

column4: #FeedmetheTruth I want to know which foods Sainsbury s sell that have GMOs including animals fed GMO feed?
column9: That's an impossible task Sainsbury's should force all producers and manufactures to label GMOs I for one will not shop in Sainsbury's while they support GMOs and ensure that everyone on my social media pages are aware.

column4: I recently purchased your  vanilla cup cake kit  to make cakes for the children in need fundraiser at my son  school. I made the cakes with little fuss  and  even though I find icing cakes to be one of the most arduous tasks in the world  I even managed to get the pink icing to look half decent . Feeling rather proud of my accomplishment I added the milk chocolate buttons to the top and considered it a job well done  until... I realised  staring back at me  on the plate  were 6 iced cake boobs of varying size. This was confirmed by Julie  my mother  who I assure you will never let me live this down!   Now  I m not sure who thought it would be a good idea to have pink iced cupcakes and chocolate buttons to decorate them  but I can assume the teachers at my son s school would have probably not agreed.   I would post a picture of the offending cakes but I think that it might be reported and removed due to it containing  nudity .  Luckily after many baking mishaps I have an array of cake decorations in the cupboard and so disaster has been avoided.   To avoid potential embarrassment for others in the future  you may wish to add a warning to the box  change the icing colour or maybe rebrand as hen-do cup cakes?  Kind Regards Jordan
column9: Hi Daniel, they were from the store in Taunton, however I'm not sure what they could do, apart from putting parent advisory stickers on all the boxes ðŸ˜†

column4: I recently purchased your  vanilla cup cake kit  to make cakes for the children in need fundraiser at my son  school. I made the cakes with little fuss  and  even though I find icing cakes to be one of the most arduous tasks in the world  I even managed to get the pink icing to look half decent . Feeling rather proud of my accomplishment I added the milk chocolate buttons to the top and considered it a job well done  until... I realised  staring back at me  on the plate  were 6 iced cake boobs of varying size. This was confirmed by Julie  my mother  who I assure you will never let me live this down!   Now  I m not sure who thought it would be a good idea to have pink iced cupcakes and chocolate buttons to decorate them  but I can assume the teachers at my son s school would have probably not agreed.   I would post a picture of the offending cakes but I think that it might be reported and removed due to it containing  nudity .  Luckily after many baking mishaps I have an array of cake decorations in the cupboard and so disaster has been avoided.   To avoid potential embarrassment for others in the future  you may wish to add a warning to the box  change the icing colour or maybe rebrand as hen-do cup cakes?  Kind Regards Jordan
column9: Hi Jordan. Thanks for that. I have logged your feedback within the business. Have a good weekend! Sonny

column4: I was in your Telford Store today  and i spent nearly Â£60 on clothes. At the checkout i asked the Assistant to take Â£10 worth of Nectar points off my card towards the shop  which she did  and then asked if i knew about the Double Up offer.  Apparently i could have doubled my points to get Â£20 off my clothing.. I wasn t aware of it  and apparently at that point it was too late to do anything about it as she d already taken the points. As this is a scheme only running for a week  is it really Sainsburys policy for your Checkout staff to only ask if the customers know about it AFTER they ve already removed the points and its impossible to get them doubled? I m really quite annoyed  i don t have much money and when buying christmas presents  every penny counts.
column9: Actually, i think you'll find it is. Checkout Staff are the Customer Service face of the store and often the last opportunity for the store to make a positive experience for a customer before they leave the store. They are there to provide a good service, which includes informing customers of any promotions or policies currently operating, especially this time of the year. I worked the checkouts of another major grocery retailer for over 10 yrs and this kind of thing is part of the job of a checkout assistant.

column4: Blimey Sainsbury s  you might want to buy your poor collection staff in your Milton Keynes store some equipment that actually works! Went in today at 2pm to collect a parcel (that should have been there at nine but didn t get the email to collect til nearly 1pm) and after using your touch screen I waited and waited and waited. By 2.15 I queued at customer services and eventually got served and a woman came out who initially tried to imply u didn t use the screen properly (I had  and I wasn t the only person waiting!) But she re did it all and went off to collect it. And then when she did bring it out she apologised and said my order hadn t been sent to her device  but had been sent to two devices that weren t in use! But then it took even longer as her device wouldn t scan any of the barcodes! 35 minutes it took to collect a parcel! It s not the staffs fault  it s the rubbish equipment that Sainsbury s are providing them! I choose this service as it s usually relatively hassle free and quick  but i don t think I ll bother again!
column9: No, i didn't catch names, to be fair the women were both lovely and it really wasn't their fault things were not working. The equipment was seriously letting them down, orders not going to handsets and then handsets not scanning barcodes so everything having to be done manually. I've only used this service three times and had non scanning handsets twice. All in the last week! I wasn't the only customer having problems. Just the length of time it dragged in today was ridiculous.

column4: Scary moment in one of your cafes today. Me and my son were happily tucking into lunch... me and jacket potato and him a children s chicken and sweet corn sandwich.... I went to give him another piece and ate the other half myself only to find a really sharp piece of bone in it! Obviously I rushed to take the rest of the sandwich off him  resulting in a massive melt down.  After speaking to a member of staff who offered me a new sandwich and informed me that it warns you on the back. In very small print.  To be honest I feel this warning is not big enough. My son doesn t understand not to eat a bone. It would be very messy to check the whole sandwich myself. I free this filling is not an appropriate thing to advertising suitable for a child and could of ended very badly for us today. I m not sure it will be our venue of choice for next week which is a shame because it was a favourite ðŸ˜”
column9: Hi Tanya! I'm so sorry about this but glad your son is okay! What store did this happen in? Dee

column4: Scary moment in one of your cafes today. Me and my son were happily tucking into lunch... me and jacket potato and him a children s chicken and sweet corn sandwich.... I went to give him another piece and ate the other half myself only to find a really sharp piece of bone in it! Obviously I rushed to take the rest of the sandwich off him  resulting in a massive melt down.  After speaking to a member of staff who offered me a new sandwich and informed me that it warns you on the back. In very small print.  To be honest I feel this warning is not big enough. My son doesn t understand not to eat a bone. It would be very messy to check the whole sandwich myself. I free this filling is not an appropriate thing to advertising suitable for a child and could of ended very badly for us today. I m not sure it will be our venue of choice for next week which is a shame because it was a favourite ðŸ˜”

column4: Just a quick message to say how disappointed I have been today with the service in your Newbury store. I went in to double up the Nectar points I have been saving all year to spend at Christmas  you only had 2 people working on your customer service desk and a massive que! There was another man swanning around  helping  people with doubling up their points but not actually doing anything. When the lady behind me asked if there was anyone else to help on the service desk he said that the other 2 people that should be on there had  had to go and help elsewhere in the store then walked off with a massive smile on his face. This was not helpful  especially as my 2 year old was crying and screaming in my trolley. Both the ladies on the desk were dealing what could only be difficult refund/exchanges as they seemed to be there for ages  in the end I just left  leaving my trolley of shopping there as I couldn t waiting any longer. So thank you Sainburys you have cost me more this Christmas as it is very doubtful I will be able to make it back to a store before your double up event ends!!!!

column4: I had the horrible experience of having my purse stolen last week and of course my Nectar card was in it. I rang Nectar and they promised to send me a new card with my points transferred onto it. I also had a series of coupons from Sainsbury s though so I rang Sainsbury s. The coupons ran for 4 weeks  I had already used week 1  spending Â£60+ and receiving a coupon for 12p off each litre of fuel I bought  which I also used. Week 2 was spend Â£60  save Â£6  weeks 3 and 4 were repeats of weeks 1 and 2. If I used all 4 I would get 500 free points. I rang my local Sainsbury s  they said I couldn t use the vouchers without the card that was stolen. I rang customer services  same result. Nectar weren t interested because they weren t their coupons. Sainsbury s can afford to throw away a minimum of Â£220 worth of my business  based on a minimum spend of Â£60 for 3 weeks and Â£40 fuel for my car. Is my business really that worthless to Sainsbury s? In these days of strong competition from your competitors I would have expected to value loyal customers. My mother has shopped at Sainsbury s for over 50 years but we weren t even allowed to use my vouchers with her card. It s not what I would call good customer service!
column9: These are the coupons, I have close up photos too if this one isn't clear enough. Nectar said they were sending a card but out of all of the loyalty cards I had it is the only one that hasn't arrived yet. I live with my Mum and she has a Nectar card registered to the same address but I was told we couldn't use that either. The purse was stolen on November 8th so I wasn't able to use the second coupon before it went out of date but I did ring up before it was to see if we could use it with Mum's card.

column4: To free up a little money before pay day at the end of the month I thought I could purchase a Sainsbury Gift Card via an online reseller and pay using Paypal Credit (essentially an E-Credit facility that does not provide a physical card) and use this card to fill the car with petrol thus allowing money for general day to day spending.  Concerned I might not be able to use the card in a petrol station I checked on your own website first and found https://www.sainsburysgifts.co.uk/excluded_products.html that it is not listed. I thought if not listed as an excluded product then it is fairly reasonable to assume that it is permissible to use for fuel.  The card arrived today and the first sentence on the back says it cannot be used in petrol stations. Not much use after its already been bought. First sentence on the back of the card. Doesn t crack the top 15 on the excluded products list. You should probably rectify that.
column9: Not sure how to PM as a page so here is a screen shot with most of the number redacted. I wasn't sure if you needed to check the number or just specifically what the GC says.

column4: Well sainsburys I was excited about the double up that started today as I had set time to come in while the kids were at school to get some Christmas presents!!!! You really need to look at your system for double up! To only be able to double Â£20 to Â£40 as a maximum and have to do each voucher in a single transaction was an absolute bloody nightmare! I had my 1 yr old daughter kicking off a rude customer service agent on the desk who didn t know what she was doing and I had Â£85 that I was changing up across clothing and technology.  So stressful and have to say I very much doubt I will use this double up event again.  Tesco have a much better system where you double your points get vouchers and it all goes through with your shopping.
column9: Sounds like the double up system in Sainsburys is the same as used last year, I found no problem with it then, and used vouchers in 4 categories..  You can get your vouchers, for your double up points in advance, this has been possible for a week now, and then put the  voucher and item  through the tills with your shopping, or you can do the whole process at the customer service till. There is  Â£40 limit per category, yes I would  have liked more too, but it is still a worthwhile saving ..hope you managed to get what you wanted.

column4: Hi Sainsbury s  just got back home from your westhoughton store absolutely fuming! Had a call from my Nan asking if I had Â£10 or more worth in nectar points as Sainsbury s have a  double up  scheme through nectar and she wanted a blouse and knew she d technically get it free if she could use my nectar points. I thought why not I can also get myself a clothing item considering I ll have double the amount of money.  I went to Sainsbury s westhoughton  went over to the customer service desk and asked for my double points in clothes vouchers. The lady at the desk gave me two vouchers the top one being a Â£10 clothing voucher so I assumed I wouldn t have to check the second one underneath as that should also be a Â£10 clothing voucher as well making it a total of Â£20 in clothing vouchers hence your double up nectar points scheme. We picked up what we wanted and made our way to the check out  I automatically handed over both vouchers to my disbelief have one of them handed back to me  I read on the voucher it said   Â£18 off delivery  on the voucher. To this point I was confused paid the lady at the till only getting Â£10 off the clothes instead of Â£20. I asked my Nan surely I should have had Â£20 in vouchers not Â£10 as it s a double up scheme. So we went back to the customer service desk to be served by the same lady. Mucking us about was an understatement  first of all she was pretty much accusing me of lying claiming I only ask for Â£10 in clothing vouchers to which I asked her why would I ask for Â£10 when I asked for the double points scheme! She then went to refund one of the items to then give us another Â£10 voucher but the item she refunded us was under Â£10 and asked if I could go and get a chocolate bar or a packet of crisps to round up the amount to Â£10 to which I had to run around looking for a couple of kitkats to make it a pound so it was rounded to Â£10. She scanned them and said oh sorry you can t have these with the voucher as it s clothing which I would have thought she would have already knew that anyway to then ask me for a Â£1 to then refund it and then she was asking me to go back in the clothing department and look for something else that s a Â£1 so she could allow me to buy my item back and then refund this Â£1 again! So there s me running around like an idiot to try and find something that was a Â£1 in the clothing department that I didn t want to get in the first place just so I could get it refunded to then get my item back!  So Sainsbury s I recommend that in future you educate your staff on how to double up points/money  make sure they check what they have printed off for their customers and maybe not muck their customers about making them running all over the shop floors! ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡

column4: Ive just seen your christmas ad for this year. So technically this man wants to spend time with his family but cant due to work pressure etc. So could you explain to us why you as an employer dont practise what you preach? Staff will be in store working until late Christmas eve and expected back in at 5am boxing day?   Wouldnt it be nice if your staff could spend some quality time with their families.  Christmas day itself is a blur for most people and tend relax more on boxing day. I eagerly await your thoughts on this matter.
column9: Hiya Andrea, sorry for the late response! We understand that Christmas is an important time of year for everyone to celebrate with their families. Serving our customers wherever and whenever they want is at the heart of what we do. For the past six years we have had our stores open in order to serve our customers who wish to shop with us on this day. It is an extremely popular day for us and always has a high demand for us to be open â€“ last year there were over two million transactions in our stores on Boxing Day alone. We know that everyone would love more time to spend with their families and we do accommodate to this as much as we can. Gabby.

column4: Ive just seen your christmas ad for this year. column9: Thank you for responding but that still doesn't answer the question of the double standards you have shown with your ad campaign. I await your renewed response.

column4: Ive just seen your christmas ad for this year. column9: Also, i believe there are 1374 Sainsbury stores in the uk so on average 4366 transactions per store. Hardly worth the cost of being open. I dare you to start a trend by closing on boxing day. People won't starve due to a 2 day closure and you will ultimately end up with happy staff. A happy staff is a productive one.  The only people who truly NEED to work are those in emergency services and care. (which for the record, is where i work) Why help in making society a 24 hour year round entity?

column9: I see where you're coming from Andrea, and I don't want to just regurgitate the same information but two million people wanting to shop isn't a small number. As a business we are required to satisfy a demand when there is one but I can empathise with those who would rather be at home. What I would like to do is log your feedback properly with the right people so it can be considered in the future. What store do you usually shop in? Just for logging purposes. Thanks, Steve.

column4: I recently returned to Sainsbury online shopping  after a 6 year gap with a competitor. The first delivery went without incident. I was very pleased with my shop.... The 2nd I dropped an empty delivery crate on my big toe  and broke it. I have never broken a bone before... I can now vouch... it hurts... it also makes walking a tad difficult.... next time I will be more careful...... This week was delivery 3. On unpacking the bleach it leaked on my favourite jumper. Gutted....... Oh  and I forgot the icecream again ( I haven t tod the girls yet...eeek)... I really need to add it to favourites......Its common for these things to come in 3s. Feeling a little anxious about what is in store for next time... wish me luck
column9: Its not a complaint..... I dropped the crate on my own foot.... The broken toe order was 151218466. Its slowly getting better... The bleach order was yesterday 152536586. column4: Feeling very angry and upset this evening.  Yesterday I went to the large sainsburys in crawley and ended up purchasing some clothes for my little boy  I could nt really afford them but I decided to use my 27.50 of points. No where in the store was there anything saying it was double points  not one poster or anything advertising it.. I was not told at the till when i purchased the items either even though they must of known! I had to go back today to change the sizes of a couple of items.  At the customer service desk where I was queing there was a leaflet about double points up this november  while i stood there reading it I couldnt beleive that i had missed out on this the 27.50 could have been 50!  I asked if I could have it exchanged with points and was told there was nothing I could do.  I have spent ages saving my points and this is how I am repayed! I am gutted as thats alot of money I have missed out on.  I am so disappointed that I will tomorrow return all my clothing items to sainsburys and never shop there again.  When you shop in tesco it is very very clear when they have a promotion on!!!! DISGUSTED

column4: Why are you such an expensive supermarket and also the dearest supermarket for petrol I won t shop in yours again as you rip people of with your prices
column9: The fuel market is extremely competitive and prices are very volatile in the current climate. Prices differ throughout the UK and you will see varying prices even between outlets owned by the same company.  We want to ensure our petrol stations remain competitive within their local area, offering customers a fair price wherever they live.  We therefore adjust the price at each station using locally gathered pricing information.   We also run regular promotions on fuel including bonus Nectar points and money off per litre when spending a qualifying amount in our stores.  Steven

column4: So are you closed Boxing Day?  Your advert is promoting spending time with your family over Christmas  are you closed so that your employees can do the same?
column9: We are really proud that at Christmas we will do a great job of serving our customers wherever and whenever they want us to. This is at the heart of what we are about as a big retailer, particularly at the busiest time of year when our customers rely on us to help them celebrate with everything they need. We also know that this is an important time of year for our colleagues, and we will do everything we can to help them have the time off that they ask for and want to spend with their families. Faiza.

column4: Hey Sainsbury s  here s a little poem for you about my sad day yesterday and some custard doughnuts that were in my online shop with you...  I had the day from hell today Of custard doughnuts I did dream It got me through from start til end Those doughnuts filled with custard cream... A long drive home through traffic bad  Kids bathed and put to bed  A cup of tea  the sofa called  Time for me to now be fed... The doughnuts I d been dreaming of  For all the hellish day  All that yummy custard filling  About to come my way... Imagine my total despair  When into one I bit  And not one drop of custard  Was there to give me my hit.. I tried every doughnut in the bag And each was just the same And now I sit here crying Please help to right this pain.
column9: Oh my gosh I can't believe it sounds like quite a day, I'm really sorry that our doughnuts let you down in that way!  I want to try & make it right, take away your despair, But I need some more info to make our suppliers aware.  Can you PM us your details - full name, order number & post code too I'll try my best to take you away from feeling oh so blue! We'll need to try & sort this out, make things turn out right, We want no other customer to go through this terrible fright!   Speak soon!   Kirsty

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day!    Can someone at Sainsbury s explain to me why you need to open on Boxing Day???

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day!    Can someone at Sainsbury s explain to me why you need to open on Boxing Day???
column9: Hi Liz, thanks for getting in touch. Serving our customers wherever and whenever they want is at the heart of what we do. We have been open in selected stores on Boxing Day for the last 6 years and our sales data shows us that more and more people are shopping with us on Boxing Day â€“ last year there were over two million transactions in our stores on Boxing Day alone. Where there is a demand, we will always try to meet this to better serve our customers. Steve.

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day!    Can someone at Sainsbury s explain to me why you need to open on Boxing Day???
column9: Sainsbury's thanks for your reply Steve. I expected exactly this response. I know that if your doors are open, people will come, but isn't it time that one of the 'big 6' tried something different? Would it really make that much difference to your profits if you didn't open for just one extra day over the holidays? If you lead, the others will follow and your staff and their families will get 'the greatest gift of christmas' that you so beautifully portray in your advert. Of course, Sainsbury's won't change their opening hours because of my Facebook post but it's worth a try...after all we all call it 'giraffe bread' now...

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day! column9: It's only the big 4 that are open then...Sainsbury's, Tesco, Morrisons and Asda

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day!    Can someone at Sainsbury s explain to me why you need to open on Boxing Day???
column9: I see where you're coming from Liz, I really do. Christmas is meant to be a time for family but in the last few years especially it's become common for businesses to open their doors on Boxing day. Obviously these decisions are made a little higher up in the chain but what I can do is log your feedback with the company. You make a good point about the giraffe bread, and it's feedback like this which can help facilitate change in the long run. I just need a store name for logging purposes, would you be able to tell me where you shop? Hope you enjoyed the advert, Steve.

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day! column9: I completely agree with you Katrina. It would be lovely if ONLY our emergency and care services had to work on Christmas Day and Boxing Day. I hadn't thought about hotel workers to be honest, now I'm cross about them having to work too!!

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day!    Can someone at Sainsbury s explain to me why you need to open on Boxing Day???
column9: I don't disagree with you that consumerism on a large scale could take a day off after Christmas. But let's not forget hotels and restaurants that require staff on Christmas day. Why is it ok to expect someone's dad to cook Christmas lunch for 50 people and yet not his own family? There are so many types of industry working behind the scenes on Christmas Day itself that is more offensive than people working Boxing Day...surely?

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day!    Can someone at Sainsbury s explain to me why you need to open on Boxing Day???
column9: Nice one!

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day!    Can someone at Sainsbury s explain to me why you need to open on Boxing Day???
column9: Very sorry Liz, this bounced back to another colleague when I wanted to finish dealing with this myself. It's true about hotel workers, I used to work in one but that's a different story! I think the main thing to take away from this is that as a business we need to balance the needs of the employees and the demands of the customer. Due to a few different factors including Boxing Day sales and the rise of capitalist consumerism there is a large demand for stores to be open on Boxing Day. I'm not trying to justify it, and it's definitely a much bigger issue than individual supermarkets but I hope that I've been able to alleviate some of your concerns. I can't change the world but I can pass your comments to the people that can. I can now confirm that this has been officially logged and I hope you have a lovely Christmas (and Boxing day if you're not working!). All the best, Steve.

column4: I like the message of your Christmas advert this year but all I could think about while watching it was that your staff could have more time with their families over Christmas if you didn t insist on opening on Boxing Day! You can't close hospitals for holidays but do food shops really need to open?

Today she went out of her way to assist me packing my shopping into bags and putting it in the trolley for me whilst my 10 month old was sleeping in my arms.  Also held a lovely conversation with my 3 year old asking how her day had been.  Really appreciate her help  and after such a stressful morning she managed to put a smile back on my face.
